1 using System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis;
2 using System.Windows;
3 using System.Windows.Controls;

5 namespace Fasetto.Word
6 {
7  /// <summary>
8  /// Interaction logic for PageHost.xaml
9  /// </summary>
10  public partial class PageHost : UserControl
11  {
12  #region Dependency Properties
13 
14  /// <summary>
15  /// Registers <see cref="CurrentPage"/> as a dependency property
16  /// </summary>
17  public static readonly DependencyProperty CurrentPageProperty =
18  DependencyProperty.Register(nameof(CurrentPage), typeof(BasePage), typeof(PageHost), new UIPropertyMetadata(CurrentPagePropertyChanged));
19 
20  /// <summary>
21  /// The current page to show in the page host
22  /// </summary>
23  public BasePage CurrentPage
24  {
25  get => (BasePage)GetValue(CurrentPageProperty);
26  set => SetValue(CurrentPageProperty, value);
27  }
28 
29  #endregion Dependency Properties
30 
31  #region Constructor
32 
33  /// <summary>
34  /// Default constructor
35  /// </summary>
36  public PageHost()
37  {
38  InitializeComponent();
39  }
40 
41  #endregion Constructor
42 
43  #region Property Changed Events
44 
45  /// <summary>
46  /// Called when the <see cref="CurrentPage"/> value has changed
47  /// </summary>
48  /// <param name="sender"></param>
49  /// <param name="e"></param>
50  [SuppressMessage("ReSharper", "PossibleNullReferenceException")]
51  private static void CurrentPagePropertyChanged(DependencyObject sender, DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs e)
52  {
53  // Get the frames
54  var oldPageFrame = (sender as PageHost).OldPage;
55  var newPageFrame = (sender as PageHost).NewPage;
56 
57  // Store the current page content as the old page
58  var oldPageContent = newPageFrame.Content;
59 
60  // Remove current page from newPageFrame
61  newPageFrame.Content = null;
62 
63  //Move the previous page into the old frame
64  oldPageFrame.Content = oldPageContent;
65 
66  //Animate out old page when the Loaded event fires
67  //right after this call due to moving frames
68  if (oldPageContent is BasePage oldPage)
69  {
70  oldPage.AnimateOut = true;
71  }
72 
73  //Set the new page content
74  newPageFrame.Content = e.NewValue;
75  }
76 
77  #endregion Property Changed Events
78  }
79 }
